alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 9:53PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Kimball, southwestern Banner and southeastern Laramie Counties through 930 PM MDT... At 853 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a gusty showers near Burns and Pine Bluffs, or 27 miles east of Cheyenne, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluffs, Burns, Albin, Oliver Campground, Hillsdale, Oliver Reservoir, Kimball Airport, Gun Barrel, Panorama Point, Carpenter and Bushnell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 377 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska...and southeastern Wyoming.
